fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.thermostat

Class OutsideTemperature

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
          • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.thermostat.AbstractPlottingHIOA
            • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.examples.thermostat.OutsideTemperature
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, VariableInitialisationI, AtomicModelI, EventsExchangingI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExportedVariable(name="outsideTemperature",
                       type=java.lang.Double.class)
public class OutsideTemperature
extends AbstractPlottingHIOA
    The class OutsideTemperature implements an atomic HIOA model that produces a model for outside temperature.

    Description

    The outside temperature model combines a periodic variation of the temperature over a day following a sine curve to which a gaussian noise is added.

    • Imported events: none
    • Exported events: none
    • Imported variables: none
    • Exported variables: name = outsideTemperature, type = Double

    Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2022-07-12

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> fixpointInitialiseVariables()
      initialise the model variables with a more elaborated protocol when external model variables depend of each others, hence models importing variables have to wait until these variables are themselves initialised so this protocol will allow to call repetitively the method until all variables are initialised without having to respect any order among models (but models cannot have circular dependencies); this method must be called after the method initialiseState.
      void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
      .
      void setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> simParams)
      set the simulation parameters for a simulation run.
      Duration timeAdvance()
      return the time the simulated system remains in the current state before making a transition to the next sequential state; the method must be implemented by the user in each atomic model.
      boolean useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
      return true if the model uses the fixpoint algorithm to initialise its model variables, false otherwise; when true, the method fixpointInitialiseVariables must be implemented by the model, and when false, it is the method initialiseVariables that must be.
      void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      perform an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

      • setSimulationRunParameters

        public void setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> simParams)
                                throws MissingRunParameterException
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        set the simulation parameters for a simulation run.

        Description

        This method is the same as fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces.SimulationManagementI#setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map). It could be factored out in a separate interface, but maybe a too complicated solution for just one method.

        Contract

         pre     simParams != null && simParams.size() > 0
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        setSimulationRunParameters in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        setSimulationRunParameters in class AbstractPlottingHIOA
        Parameters:
        simParams - map from parameters names to their values.
        Throws:
        MissingRunParameterException - if an expected run parameter does not appear in simParams (including simParams being null).
        See Also:
        AbstractPlottingHIOA.setSimulationRunParameters(Map)

      • useFixpointInitialiseVariables

        public boolean useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
        Description copied from interface: VariableInitialisationI
        return true if the model uses the fixpoint algorithm to initialise its model variables, false otherwise; when true, the method fixpointInitialiseVariables must be implemented by the model, and when false, it is the method initialiseVariables that must be.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        true if the model uses the fixpoint algorithm to initialise its model variables, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        VariableInitialisationI.useFixpointInitialiseVariables()

      • fixpointInitialiseVariables

        public Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> fixpointInitialiseVariables()
        Description copied from interface: VariableInitialisationI
        initialise the model variables with a more elaborated protocol when external model variables depend of each others, hence models importing variables have to wait until these variables are themselves initialised so this protocol will allow to call repetitively the method until all variables are initialised without having to respect any order among models (but models cannot have circular dependencies); this method must be called after the method initialiseState.

        Contract

         pre     useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
 pre     allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
 post    ret.getFirst() >= 0 && ret.getSecond() >= 0
 post    !(ret.getFirst() >= 0 || ret.getSecond() == 0) || allModelVariablesInitialised()
        Returns:
        a pair which first element is the number of newly initialised variables (i.e.) and the second the number of non initialised yet variables.
        See Also:
        VariableInitialisationI.fixpointInitialiseVariables()

      • timeAdvance

        public Duration timeAdvance()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        return the time the simulated system remains in the current state before making a transition to the next sequential state; the method must be implemented by the user in each atomic model.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        the time the simulated system remains in the current state before making an internal transition to the next state.
        See Also:
        ModelI.timeAdvance()

      • userDefinedInternalTransition

        public void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        perform an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Overrides:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in class AtomicModel
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time since the last event.
        See Also:
        AtomicModel.userDefinedInternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)
